comments.author: beads-tui-dev
comments.text: Root cause: AddingComment, ClosingBead, and ReopeningBead input modes were matching KeyCode::Enter without checking shift modifier, so Shift+Enter would submit/close the modal instead of inserting a newline. Fixed by adding shift check to all three handlers - now only plain Enter submits, Shift+Enter passes through to tui-textarea for newline insertion.

comments.author: beads-tui-dev
comments.text: Root cause: User's ghostty terminal config sends Shift+Enter as text:\n which crossterm receives as Ctrl+J. tui-textarea's default Ctrl+J binding is 'delete line to beginning' (not insert newline), causing text to disappear. Fixed by intercepting Ctrl+J in all text input modes and explicitly inserting newline instead of passing to tui-textarea.

title: Replace custom TextInput with tui-textarea
description:
Replace our custom TextInput widget implementation with the tui-textarea crate.

tui-textarea is a mature, well-tested multi-line text editor widget that handles:
- Multi-line and single-line editing
- Proper cursor positioning (char vs byte offsets)
- UTF-8 handling
- Terminal-style key bindings (Ctrl+A/E/W/K/U, Alt+B/F, etc.)
- Scrolling and windowing

Our custom implementation has bugs with cursor positioning in multiline mode (bd-1n8). Using tui-textarea will fix these issues and reduce maintenance burden.

Changes needed:
1. Add tui-textarea dependency to Cargo.toml
2. Replace TextInput struct in src/ui/input.rs with tui_textarea::TextArea
3. Update CreateModal to use TextArea
4. Test thoroughly in the create modal
5. Remove old TextInput code and tests
close_reason: Successfully migrated to tui-textarea v0.7. All text input now uses the mature library instead of our buggy custom implementation. Multiline navigation works correctly!

description:

1. Beads with a "deferred" label should render with italic text in the list view
2. In the tree ordering, deferred beads (label=deferred) should appear after all non-deferred open beads, regardless of priority
3. Within the deferred group, maintain normal priority+title sorting
4. The italic styling should apply to the title text span
5. All existing tests pass, clippy clean, fmt clean

## Implementation Notes
- "Deferred" is a label, not a status - check bead.labels for "deferred"
- Modify build_tree_order() in data/bead.rs to separate deferred from non-deferred roots
- Modify render_bead() in ui/list.rs to add Modifier::ITALIC for deferred beads
- No new dependencies needed - ratatui already supports ITALIC modifier
